bill_title: require that firearms be cased and unloaded during the crossing of certain private lands.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that firearms be cased and unloaded during the crossing of certain private lands. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person who lawfully crosses private land on which the person does not have permission to hunt in order to reach land on which the person is authorized to hunt may hunt on the private land being crossed, and no such person while on the private land may carry or have in possession any uncased firearm. Any firearm carried by or in the possession of the person while on the private land shall be unloaded. Nothing in this Act authorizes any person to enter onto private land for any purpose if the person is not otherwise authorized to do so. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
